Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw different types of living things in a land habitat, such as a forest or garden.
The student can identify and draw different types of living things in a water habitat, such as a pond or stream.
The student can draw patterns of diversity by showing a variety of plants and animals within a single habitat.
The student can compare different habitats by drawing and labeling distinct living things that exist in each, such as different plants in a playground versus a garden.
The student can use observations to draw and label the unique features of each habitat that support different kinds of life.
